lines.line: Hello young one.
Cross my palm with silver and the future will be revealed to you.
Oh dear. I don't have any money.
Okay, here you go.
Come closer, and listen carefully to what the future holds for you, as I peer into the swirling mists of the crystal ball.
I can see images forming. I can see you.
You are holding a very impressive looking sword. I'm sure I recognise that sword...
There is a big dark shadow appearing now.
Aaargh!
Are you all right?
It's Delrith! Delrith is coming!
Who's Delrith?
Delrith...
Delrith is a powerful demon.
Oh! I really hope he didn't see me looking at him through my crystal ball!
He tried to destroy this city 150 years ago. He was stopped just in time by the great hero Wally.
Using his magic sword Silverlight, Wally managed to trap the demon in the stone circle just south of this city.
Ye gods! Silverlight was the sword you were holding in my vision! You are the one destined to stop the demon this time.
How am I meant to fight a demon who can destroy cities?!
If you face Delrith while he is still weak from being summoned, and use the correct weapon, you will not find the task too arduous.
Do not fear. If you follow the path of the great hero Wally, then you are sure to defeat the demon.
Okay, where is he? I'll kill him for you!
Ah, the overconfidence of the young!
Delrith can't be harmed by ordinary weapons. You must face him using the same weapon that Wally used.
Wally doesn't sound a very heroic name.
Yes I know. Maybe that is why history doesn't remember him. However he was a very great hero.
Who knows how much pain and suffering Delrith would have brought forth without Wally to stop him!
It looks like you are going to need to perform similar heroics.
So how did Wally kill Delrith?
Wally managed to arrive at the stone circle just as Delrith was summoned by a cult of chaos druids...
Die, foul demon!
Now, what was that incantation again?
I am the greatest demon slayer EVER!
By reciting the correct magical incantation, and thrusting Silverlight into Delrith while he was newly summoned, Wally was able to imprison Delrith in the stone block in the centre of the circle.
Delrith will come forth from the stone circle again.
I would imagine an evil sorcerer is already starting on the rituals to summon Delrith as we speak.
What is the magical incantation?
Oh yes, let me think a second...
Alright, I think I've got it now, it goes... Have you got that?
I think so, yes.
Where can I find Silverlight?
Silverlight has been passed down through Wally's descendants. I believe it is currently in the care of one of the King's knights called Sir Prysin.
He shouldn't be too hard to find. He lives in the royal palace in this city. Tell him Aris sent you.
Ok thanks. I'll do my best to stop the demon.
Good luck, and may Guthix be with you!
No, I don't believe in that stuff.
Ok suit yourself.
Greetings. How goes thy quest?
I'm still working on it.
Well if you need any advice I'm always here, young one.
Stop calling me that!
In the scheme of things you are very young.
Ok, but how old are you?
Count the number of legs on the stools in the Blue Moon inn, and multiply that number by seven.
Er, yeah, whatever.
Oh if it's in the scheme of things that's ok.
You show wisdom for one so young.
Well I'd better press on with it.
See you anon.
Hello, who are you?
I am a mighty adventurer, who are you?
I am Sir Prysin. A bold and famous knight of the realm.
I was hoping you could tell me.
Well I've never met you before.
Aris said I should come and talk to you.
Aris? Is she still alive? I remember her from when I was pretty young. Well what do you need to talk to me about?
I need to find Silverlight.
What do you need to find that for?
I need it to fight Delrith.
Delrith? I thought the world was rid of him, thanks to my great-grandfather.
Well Aris' crystal ball seems to think otherwise.
Well if the ball says so, I'd better help you.
The problem is getting Silverlight.
You mean you don't have it?
Oh I do have it, but it is so powerful that the king made me put it in a special box which needs three different keys to open it. That way it won't fall into the wrong hands.
So give me the keys!
Um, well, it's not so easy.
I kept one of the keys. I gave the other two to other people for safe keeping.
One I gave to Rovin, the captain of the palace guard.
I gave the other to the wizard Traiborn.
Can you give me your key?
Well there's a problem there as well.
I managed to drop the key in the drain just outside the palace kitchen. It is just inside and I can't reach it.
So what does the drain connect to?
It is the drain for the drainpipe running from the sink in the kitchen down to the palace sewers.
Well I'd better go key hunting.
Ok, goodbye.
Where can I find Captain Rovin?
Captain Rovin lives at the top of the guards' quarters in the north-west wing of this palace.
Where does the wizard live?
Wizard Traiborn?
He is one of the wizards who lives in the tower on the little island just off the south coast. I believe his quarters are on the first floor of the tower.
And why is this a problem?
He's back and unfortunately I've got to deal with him.
You don't look up to much. I suppose Silverlight may be good enough to carry you through though.
Yes she is still alive. She lives right outside the castle!
Oh, is that the same Aris? I would have thought she would have died by now. She was pretty old when I was a lad.
Anyway, what can I do for you?
So how are you doing with getting the keys?
I haven't found any of them yet.
Can you remind me where all the keys were again?
I'm still looking.
Ok, tell me when you've got them all.
I've got the key from Captain Rovin.
I've got the key from Wizard Traiborn.
I've got the key which you dropped down the drain.
I've got the keys from Wizard Traiborn and Captain Rovin.
I've got the key from Captain Rovin and the one that you dropped down the drain.
I've got the key from Wizard Traiborn and the one that you dropped down the drain.
What are you doing up here? Only the palace guards are allowed up here.
Yes, I know, but this is important.
Ok, I'm listening. Tell me what's so important.
There's a demon who wants to invade the city.
Is it a powerful demon?
Not really.
Well, I'm sure the palace guards can deal with it, then. Thanks for the information.
Yes, very.
As good as the palace guards are, I don't know if they're up to taking on a very powerful demon.
Yeah, the palace guards are rubbish!
Yeah, they're--
Wait! How dare you insult the palace guards? Get out of my sight!
It's not them who are going to fight the demon, it's me.
What, all by yourself? How are you going to do that?
I'm going to use the powerful sword Silverlight, which I believe you have one of the keys for?
Yes, I do. But why should I give it to you?
Fortune-teller Aris said I was destined to kill the demon.
A fortune-teller? Destiny? I don't believe in that stuff. I got where I am today by hard work, not by destiny! Why should I care what that mad old fortune-teller says?
Otherwise the demon will destroy the city!
You can't fool me! How do I know you haven't just made that story up to get my key?
Sir Prysin said you would give me the key.
Oh, he did, did he? Well I don't report to Sir Prysin, I report directly to the king!
I didn't work my way up through the ranks of the palace guards so I could take orders from an ill-bred moron who only has his job because his great-grandfather was a hero with a silly name!
Why did he give you one of the keys then?
Only because the king ordered him to! The king couldn't get Sir Prysin to part with his precious ancestral sword, but he made him lock it up so he couldn't lose it.
I got one key and I think some wizard got another. Now what happened to the third one?
Sir Prysin dropped it down a drain!
Ha ha ha! The idiot!
Okay, I'll give you the key, just so that it's you that kills the demon and not Sir Prysin!
Yes, you said before, haven't you killed it yet?
I already gave you my key. Check your pockets.
I already gave you my key. Maybe you left it somewhere. Have you checked your bank account?
That must be the key Sir Prysin dropped.
I don't seem to be able to reach it. I wonder if I can dislodge it somehow. That way it may go down into the sewers.
OK, I think I've washed the key down into the sewer. I'd better go down and get it!
Ello young thingummywut.
I need to get a key given to you by Sir Prysin.
Sir Prysin? Who's that? What would I want his key for?
He told me you were looking after it for him.
That wasn't very clever of him. I'd lose my head if it wasn't screwed on. Go and tell him to find someone else to look after his valuables in future.
Okay, I'll go and tell him that.
Oh that's great, if it wouldn't be too much trouble.
Err I'd better be off really.
Oh ok, have a good time, and watch out for sheep! They're more cunning than they look.
He's one of the King's knights.
Say, I remember one of the King's knights. He had nice shoes...
...and didn't like my homemade spinach rolls. Would you like a spinach roll?
Yes please.
Thank you very much.
Just tell me if you have the key.
The key? The key to what?
There's more than one key in the world don't you know? Would be a bit odd if there was only the one.
It's the key to get a sword called Silverlight.
Silverlight? Never heard of that. Sounds a good name for a ship. Are you sure it's not the name of a ship rather than a sword?
Yeah, pretty sure.
That's a pity, waste of a name.
You've lost it haven't you?
Me? Lose things? That's a nasty accusation.
Well, have you got any keys knocking around?
Now you come to mention it, yes I do have a key. It's in my special closet of valuable stuff. Now how do I get into that?
I sealed it using one of my magic rituals. So it would make sense that another ritual would open it again.
So do you know what ritual to use?
Let me think a second.
Yes a simple drazier style ritual should suffice. Hmm, main problem with that is I'll need 25 sets of bones. Now where am I going to get hold of something like that?
Hmm, that's too bad. I really need that key.
Ah well, sorry I couldn't be any more help.
I'll help get the bones for you.
Ooh that would be very good of you.
Okay, I'll speak to you when I've got some bones.
How are you doing finding bones?
I haven't got any at the moment.
Nevermind, keep working on it.
I have some bones.
Give 'em here then.
That's all of them.
I still need more.
Ok, I'll keep looking.
Hurrah! That's all 25 sets of bones.
Wings of dark and colour too, Spreading in the morning dew; Locked away I have a key; Return it now, please, unto me.
Not a problem for a friend of Sir What's-his-face.
Don't you have somewhere to be, young thingummywut? You still have that key you asked me for.
You're right. I've got a demon to slay.
I've lost the key you gave to me.
Yes I know, it was returned to me. If you want it back you're going to have to collect another 25 sets of bones.
I've got all three keys!
Excellent! Now I can give you Silverlight.
That sword belonged to my great-grandfather. Make sure you treat it with respect!
Now go kill that demon!
How goes the quest?
I found Sir Prysin. Unfortunately I haven't got the sword yet. He's made it complicated for me.
Ok, hurry, we haven't much time.
Have you sorted that demon out yet?
Not yet. And I, um, lost Silverlight.
Yes, I know, someone returned it to me. Take better care of it this time.
I have the sword now. I just need to kill the demon, I think.
Yep, that's right.
Where can I find the demon?
Just head south and you should find the stone circle just outside the city gate.
Arise, O mighty Delrith! Bring destruction to this soft, weak city!
Arise, Delrith!
Ha ha ha! At last you are free, my demonic brother! Rest now, and then have your revenge on this pitiful city!
Who's that?
Noo! Not Silverlight! Delrith is not ready yet!
I've got to get out of here...
Now what was that incantation again?

characters.name: Aris
characters.description: Ancient female, wise and mysterious, British accent with a mystical tone. A fortune-teller with vast magical powers and knowledge of history, speaks in cryptic riddles but with genuine concern for the world's fate.

characters.name: Sir Prysin
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, somewhat pompous and self-important tone. A knight who inherited his position through ancestry rather than merit, awkward and bumbling but ultimately helpful.

characters.name: Captain Rovin
characters.description: Middle-aged male, gruff British military accent, stern and suspicious tone. A self-made soldier who takes his duties seriously and resents those who gained status through birthright rather than hard work.

characters.name: Wizard Traiborn
characters.description: Elderly male, eccentric British accent, scatterbrained and whimsical tone. A powerful but absent-minded wizard who calls everyone 'thingummywut' and rambles about unrelated topics like sheep and ships.

characters.name: Wally
characters.description: Young adult male, heroic British accent, confident and brave tone. A legendary hero from 150 years ago who defeated the demon Delrith, speaks with youthful enthusiasm and dramatic flair.

characters.name: Denath
characters.description: Adult male, sinister and theatrical British accent, menacing cultist tone. A dark wizard leading demon summoning rituals who speaks with fanatical devotion, actually a demon trapped in human form.

characters.name: Dark wizard
characters.description: Adult male, hushed and cultish British accent, nervous follower tone. A lesser dark wizard who assists in demonic rituals, speaks with fearful reverence.

characters.name: Dark wizards
characters.description: Group of adult males, hushed and cultish British accents, chanting in unison. Lesser dark wizards assisting in demonic rituals, speaking with fearful reverence as a chorus.
